header.title: TEMPLE OF THE ANCIENTS Guide to Ancient Paganism Volume 1

central_thesis: The central thesis is the promotion of a pagan spiritual path centered on devotion to the god Enki/Ea/Ptah and his allied Anunnaki deities (including Ninhursag/Ninmah/Hathor). This path emphasizes spiritual advancement through meditation, energy work, and practical magic, with the ultimate goal for humans to 'become as gods' and achieve immortality in the fourth dimension, mirroring the Anunnaki. The text explicitly contrasts Enki with the biblical Jehovah (identified as Enlil), portraying Enki as humanity's benefactor and source of knowledge, while advocating for a direct, non-hierarchical relationship with these deities.

structure_content.summary: Outlines the foundational philosophy: devotion to Enki and associated Anunnaki as creator gods who granted knowledge. It posits Anunnaki as immortal beings from a higher dimension, whose path to immortality is available to humans. It also states the rejection of grandiose titles and hierarchies within the practice.

Introduces the Anunnaki as Sumerian deities, 'those who came from heaven to Earth,' discussing ancient astronaut theories (Sitchin, Shriner, Gardner) that identify them as extraterrestrials responsible for genetically modifying primitive humans. Mentions their planet Nibiru and the 'evil wind' event.

Details Enki/Ea/Ptah/Adon/The Lord's multifaceted role across Sumerian, Babylonian, and Egyptian religions as a creator, god of wisdom, sorcery, and leader of the Nibiran pioneers. It describes his work in creating Earth's environment and his subsequent demotion, contrasting him with Enlil/Yahweh and associating him with the 'serpent in the Garden of Eden' as a bringer of knowledge.

Presents Ninmah/Ninhursag/Hathor as a Sumerian goddess instrumental in human creation alongside Enki. Her roles as 'Exalted Lady' and mother goddess across various cultures are highlighted, along with her associations with the sky, sun, music, dance, arts, and her embodiment of success and joy.

An article by Laurence Gardner arguing that the biblical Jehovah (identified as Enlil) was a vengeful storm god, distinct from the merciful Lord (Adon/Enki). It posits a historical conflict where Enlil brought destruction, while Enki granted humanity knowledge (Tree of Knowledge and Life) and aid, framing Enlil as the 'real devil'.

Provides a listing and brief description of deities allied with Enki and Ninmah from Sumerian, Mesopotamian, Babylonian, and Egyptian pantheons. These include Amon, Anubis, Aya, Bastet, Dumuzi, Enzak, Hapy, Hathor, Horus, Inanna, Khepera, Lilith, Lulal, Maat, Nabu, Nanshe, Nephthys, Seshat, Set, Shamash, Shara, and Thoth, with specific attributes and associations for each. Notably, Set is included despite being 'wrongly vilified' as a god of evil in later periods.

Categorizes hostile entities and forces: Reptilians, Grays ('The Holy Host'), Angels (aiming for humanity's destruction), White Cloaks (imposters), Cherubim (powerful angels of Jehovah, depicted as monstrous), Qlippoth (ghosts, psychic vampires, cold aura beings), Phantasms (astral thought-forms), and Enemy Deities (Enlil, Ninlil, Dagon). It warns practitioners to be cautious and to avoid pantheons not allied with Enki.

Details a ritual for dedicating oneself to Enki/Ea and his associates, emphasizing personal transformation and spiritual renewal. It describes the necessary items (candles, paper, pen, optional incense, earth symbol, Enki's signature) and procedural steps for writing and burning a prayer of vow and alignment.

Presents a ritualized taboo-breaking practice, particularly for ex-Christians, to overcome subconscious fears and irrational inhibitions. Based on Diane Vera's work, it encourages intellectual preparation and a solemn, formal renunciation of figures like the Christian Trinity as a means of self-liberation, not public aggression.

Describes essential ritual implements, categorizing them by associated element: Athame (Air), Ritual Chalice (Water), Burning Bowl (Fire), Pentagrams (Earth). Additional tools include Wands (Fire), Candles (Fire), Incense Burner (Fire/Air), Bell (for signaling ritual start/end), Book of Shadows (journal), Crystals (for energy work and offerings), Sigils/Symbols/Signatures, Black Scrying Mirror, Ouija Board, and Pendulums for communication. Emphasizes respectful handling and blessing.

Explains ritual as the core of magic, driven by belief. It provides a 'Standard Ritual' format, including altar setup, bathing, lighting incense and candles, and an 'Invocation to Enki' along with specific invocations to other allied deities (Bastet, Isis, Osiris). It also details the process for consecrating and empowering ritual tools using elemental chants (e.g., Aqua, Ego Excito Ele).

Addresses the expectation of instant communication with deities, clarifying that dedication is for transformation, not immediate materialization. It stresses the importance of study, having a specific purpose for summoning, being prepared to offer something in return, and knowing the communication method. It also highlights the need to call deities multiple times to ensure attention.

Details various techniques for interacting with gods and spirits: Telepathic Uplinks/Clairaudience (requires power meditations), Psychic Vision, Scrying (using a black mirror), Talking Boards (Ouija board), and Pendulums (for yes/no answers over sigils). It advises caution and mental preparation for these practices.

Explains that Enki and his gods adhere to a strict non-interference policy, meaning they will not intervene unless specifically asked. This policy necessitates that practitioners develop discernment to identify imposters (phantasms, enemy angels) and learn self-empowerment through bio-electrical armor and precise questioning.

Discusses different states of consciousness (delta, theta, alpha, beta) measurable by EEG, relating them to physical relaxation, hypnosis, and OOBE. It notes that OOBE typically occurs in hypnagogic states and can be directly accessed through controlled awareness.

Explores parapsychology as the study of psychic phenomena, categorizing them into ESP (extra-sensory perception), including clairvoyance, astral projection, psychometry, telepathy, mediumship, Ouija/pendulum use, and precognition, and PK (psychokinesis), including telepathic sending, telekinesis, poltergeist effects, psychic healing, teleportation, and levitation.

Presents a four-fold classification of human existence (mind, body, soul, subconscious) and the universe (spiritual, mental, astral, physical worlds). It identifies the astral body (subconscious) as the 'psychic link' to the physical world, emphasizing that psychic energy flows from higher to lower worlds.

Describes Out-of-Body Experiences (OOBE) as safe and akin to sleeping, often occurring during dreams. It outlines Monroe's step-by-step techniques: body relaxation, entering the hypnagogic state, deepening relaxation (Condition C), entering a vibrational state, learning to control vibrations, beginning with partial separation, and finally dissociating from the body through 'lift-out' or 'roll-out' methods, or a 'Mind Control Method' of visualization and counting.

Offers exercises to enhance natural clairvoyant ability, such as picturing surroundings with closed eyes, focusing on the vividness of objects, and attempting to clairvoyantly tell time. It highlights visualization as an essential magical talent.

Defines the aura as multi-colored light emanations around people, composed of different layers. It distinguishes true aura perception from optical illusions and provides a list of aura colors with their associated emotional meanings (e.g., Black for Malice, Red for Energy, Yellow for Intellect, Blue for Devotion).

Explains 'clear-hearing' as closely linked to clairvoyance, presenting it as potentially more difficult to pinpoint. It discusses physical (hearing spirits, high-frequency electrical noises) and non-physical (mindspeech) manifestations, stressing the need for psychic protection and discernment when communicating with spirits to avoid mental instability.

Explains a technique for magical achievement by vividly picturing desires, concentrating intensely on the image, feeling the energy of desire, then releasing it into the 'macrocosm' and believing in its accomplishment.

Defines affirmations as positive statements repeated aloud or silently to oneself. It explains that affirmations act as suggestions to bypass the subconscious censor, aiding in self-change and personal development over time.

Describes how the mind follows attention, equating it to a flashlight beam in the dark. It explains that focusing mental energy on a specific point directs thoughts and that mental 'noise' (negative emotions/attitudes) hinders this focus.

Defines invocation as channeling deity energy into one's body for communication. It stresses extreme caution, deep familiarity and trust with the deity, and never surrendering complete control to avoid possession or impersonation by hostile entities. It suggests Ouija boards as a method for initial practice.

Provides instructions for self-exorcism or assisting others in cases of possession by unwanted entities. Methods include 'starving it out' (ignoring the entity), maintaining host awareness, physical restraint (if necessary, without harm), and using light (lighting chakras, flushing white light through the spine/crown) to expel the entity. It emphasizes calling upon allied gods for assistance.

Discusses the importance of physical health for an alert mind in magical practice. It recommends exercise, a good diet, limiting drugs, smoking, alcohol, sugar, and processed foods. Foods are ranked by 'heaviness,' with lighter foods (greens, fruits) believed to increase psychic receptivity, while heavier foods (red meats) can 'bring one down to earth'.

Describes the seven major chakras as spiritual energy centers along the spine, analogous to 'seven lamps' or 'seven seals,' each with corresponding colors, organs, glands, emotional issues, fears, and strengths. It explains that correctly opening and empowering chakras is key to becoming 'equal with the Gods' and achieving immortality. It also discusses the role of crystals and gemstones in balancing chakras due to their piezoelectric effect.
Introduces minor chakras located on fingertips, palms, and feet. It suggests visualizing them as expanding, brightening stars during meditation to enhance the power of the seven major chakras.

Explains chakras as revolving energy wheels that, when unbalanced, can affect physical and emotional well-being. It details how crystals and gemstones, through their piezoelectric effect, can help harmonize and stimulate chakra energies, promoting overall health and balance.

Describes the human bio-electrical system, comprising meridians and chakras, as the coordinator of bodily functions. It explains how chakras act as transformers for celestial energies, and how conserving sexual energy can heighten chakra functions, leading to siddhis (extraordinary human abilities) like clairvoyance and OOBE. It also introduces the aura as surrounding energy fields and includes an exercise for sensing chi with the hands.

Discusses Kundalini as a mystical, bio-electrical force symbolized by a coiled serpent, representing latent psychic energy. It warns strongly against premature or forced awakening due to severe physical and emotional damage, emphasizing the necessity of psychological balance and open chakras. It connects Kundalini to 'Logos' and explains how its blockage or suppression can lead to a state of 'klippoth' (empty husks).

Provides a step-by-step meditation series to 'Awaken' each of the seven major chakras. For each chakra, the practitioner chants a specific deity name (e.g., Maat for Crown, Enki for Root), visualizes a closed energy ball opening like a flower in a specific color, and repeats daily until the chakra remains open autonomously.

Offers simple breathing techniques for quickly empowering chakras and the aura. For chakras, energy is drawn in from all sides on the inhale. For the aura, energy is drawn in and then expanded through the body to form a glowing tube along the chakras.

Details a method for creating a protective aura shield by spinning foot chakras, then drawing energy up through each major chakra, spinning them, and finally pushing the energy out the crown chakra to form a comprehensive protective bubble around the body.

Explores shielding concepts in magical conflict, classifying shields by their effect: opposition, evasion, or interposition. It describes an abstract shield based on a 'mathematical limit,' visualizing an inch-thick hollow sphere around oneself that force cannot penetrate, created by projecting electromagnetic energy.

A meditation for purifying the aura, involving deep relaxation, expanding the aura into a clear bubble, commanding it to 'spin speed of light' until milky white. Then, lighting chakras from root to crown, visualizing their colors streaming into the aura, spinning them, and finally creating a 'pure white mist' for healing and patching the aura.

Describes a meditation performed lying down, using hand chakras to draw electromagnetic energy into the main chakras. This practice builds personal power and can be programmed for healing various physical and emotional ailments, including fever, chronic pain, infections, and even cancer.

Provides a series of Hatha Yoga exercises tailored to stimulate and release energy in each of the seven major chakras. Examples include Locust & Half Locust, Head To Knee Pose (Chakra 1); Goddess Pose, Pelvic Rock, Hip Circles, Leg Lifts (Chakra 2); Breath of Fire, Bow Pose, Pike Pose (Chakra 3); Alternate Nostril Breathing, The Cobra, The Fish (Chakra 4); The Shoulder Stand, The Fish Pose, The Plough (Chakra 5); and simple meditation with visualizations (Chakra 6). Chakra 7 repeats exercises from earlier chakras, indicating potential textual redundancy.

Lists specific musical notes (C, D, E, F, A, B, C) corresponding to each of the seven chakras, along with associated gemstones. These tones are intended to help align and open the chakras on the physical body to 'higher powers,' each note linked to specific benefits like transcending fear or promoting creative force.

Outlines a one-hour meditation in two stages: 45 minutes of rapid diaphragmatic breathing, moving attention progressively up through each of the seven chakras for 5 minutes each, followed by 15 minutes of silent sitting. The breathing rhythm increases in rapidity and gentleness as one moves to higher chakras.

A meditation technique focusing on each chakra individually, visualizing its color and spinning it clockwise for ten revolutions. Irregular movement, fading color, or counter-clockwise spinning are identified as symptoms of a chakra block, requiring more focus.

Involves visualizing chakras as upward-pointing clocks and spinning them clockwise. Each chakra is imagined as a funnel. This meditation is used to retrain irregular chakra vortices and clear blockages.

A meditation involving visualizing oneself inside two merged pyramids and performing rhythmic breathing with specific mudras. The practice involves drawing energy into a sphere at the root chakra, expanding it, and moving it to the crown, eventually causing the pyramids to spin at 'speed of light' to stabilize a flat disc.

A step-by-step 7-day meditation for advanced practitioners to clear Kundalini paths. Each day focuses on a specific chakra (Root, Sacral, Solar Plexus, Heart, Throat, Third Eye, Crown) with corresponding mudras, chants (Enki, Inanna, Horus, Thoth, Nabu, Ea, Maat), and color visualizations, repeating previous days' exercises sequentially.

Provides instructions for creating 'Psionic Energy Balls' by sending white light energy through open hand chakras to form a ball of light. This ball is then programmed with a one-word command (e.g., HEAL, DRAIN, DAMAGE, PROTECT) and 'thrown' towards its target for various magical purposes.

Describes a method for creating a protective psionic shield. It involves first creating a Psionic Energy Ball programmed with a protective command (PROTECT, BARRIER, SHIELD), then expanding one's aura, and finally throwing the energy ball against the aura to be absorbed as a protective field.

Focuses on concentration on the breath as a means to interiorize the mind, achieve stillness, and eventually reach a state of 'breathlessness' (samadhi) where the body is sustained by direct energy flow. It argues that concentration awakens innate powers, attracts opportunities, and brings insights. A relaxation technique involving tensing and relaxing the body is also described.

A quick meditation for maintaining and rejuvenating energy centers when ill or tired. It involves relaxing, expanding the aura into a clear bubble, visualizing globes of light at each chakra and feet, connecting them with a 'thick bar of light' from feet to crown, forming a barrier, and integrating it with the aura.

Presents a visual collection of sigils and signatures for various deities, including Enki, Ninmah, Ningishzidda, Inanna, Dumuzi, Utu, Lilitu, Marduk, Seth, Nephthys, Ma'at, and Damkina, intended for use in ritual and evocation.

key_concepts.definition: Sumerian deities, 'those who came from heaven to Earth,' viewed as immortal flesh beings inhabiting a higher dimension. They are credited with the creation of humans and the bestowal of knowledge and wisdom. The authors consider them real beings, not projections of consciousness.

The primary deity of devotion for the Temple of the Ancients. He is revered as the creator of humanity, the source of knowledge and wisdom, and a leader of the 'Nibiran pioneers.' He is explicitly contrasted with Enlil/Yahweh, who is presented as a vengeful storm god and the 'real devil,' while Enki is the 'Love-God' and benefactor of humanity, equated to the serpent in Eden.

A goddess who, with Enki, contributed to the creation of humans. She is described as the 'Exalted Lady,' mother goddess, and patron of sky, sun, queen, music, dance, arts, and success. She embodies joy, love, and fecundity, and is a key deity in the Anunnaki pantheon.

Derived from Sanskrit meaning 'wheel of light,' these are seven internal energy centers aligned vertically along the spine. They absorb, transform, and distribute the body's internal energy (prana, life force, or chi). Opening and empowering them correctly is considered the path to becoming 'equal with the Gods' and achieving immortality in consciousness.

A mystical force, also referred to as orgone, esprit, loosh, prana, elan vital, and bio-electricity. It is symbolized as a coiled serpent at the base of the spine, representing vast, untapped potential psychic energy. Its proper awakening can lead to psychic abilities, but forced or premature awakening with blocked chakras is warned as extremely dangerous, potentially causing severe physical and emotional damage, or creating 'klippoth' (empty husks).

An 'Out-of-Body Experience' where one's spirit or soul leaves the physical, third-dimensional body to explore the fourth dimension. In this state, the soul assumes a 'very solid physical body,' and one's powers are limited only by imagination, effectively becoming 'as the Anunnaki in their own dimension'.

Beings characterized by cold, prickly auras, often associated with ghosts or psychic vampires. They are spirits who have died 'without light' and feed from life energy to empower themselves, representing coldness and darkness. Many angels are also associated with Qlippoth.

Astral beings; some are part of the universal balance, while others are accidentally created by strong thought-forms and emotions. They are considered extremely dangerous if antagonized, and their manifestation can be triggered by thinking or talking about them.

A ritual for spiritual transformation and renewal, aligning oneself in dedication to Enki/Ea and his affiliated associates. It involves a vow to uphold high standards as an 'agent of the Human Elite' and to fight against the 'falsehoods of the Right Hand Path' and adversaries of Enki.

A self-initiation ritual (particularly recommended for ex-Christians) designed to break taboos, overcome subconscious fears, and achieve intellectual independence from past religious indoctrination. It involves deliberately blaspheming traditional religious figures, such as the Christian Trinity, to banish irrational fears and open pathways for psychic and spiritual development.

The human body's subtle bio-electrical system, composed of meridians and chakras, that coordinates physical, emotional, and spiritual functions. It acts as a channel for universal energy, and its healthy flow is crucial for overall well-being and the development of psychic abilities (siddhis).

A policy of Enki and the allied gods wherein they will not interfere in human affairs or provide information unless explicitly asked. This policy requires practitioners to develop self-awareness, discernment, and self-empowerment to distinguish genuine deities from imposters and to correctly formulate requests for assistance.

practical_system.description: The 'Temple of the Ancients' presents an operative magical system rooted in devotion to Enki and his allied Anunnaki deities, aiming for human spiritual evolution to 'become as gods.' This system is intensely practical, focusing on self-initiation, energy cultivation, and direct psychic interaction. It mandates personal responsibility, extensive study, and the development of psychic abilities (clairvoyance, clairaudience, astral projection) through structured meditations and exercises. The goal is to purify and empower the self, build protective energetic shields, and engage in direct communication with divine entities for wisdom, assistance, and eventual immortal existence in higher dimensions.
tools: Candles (black, dark blue, red, or specific deity colors)
Incense (resin, bark, self-igniting coals, safe burner)
Earth Symbol (on altar, e.g., pentagrams with Sumerian symbols)
Enkiâ€™s Signature (on altar, cuneiform or hieroglyphics)
Ritual Chalice (silver or stainless steel, associated with Water)
Burning Bowl (stainless steel or silver, associated with Fire)
Crystals (e.g., lodestone for charging, various for chakral aid)
Sigils, Symbols, and Signatures (for specific deities)
Water, sea salt, rose oil or sandalwood oil (for anointing)
rituals: The Rite of Blasphemy (including 'Ultimate Rite of Blasphemy' for ex-Christians)
Standard Ritual (including altar setup, invocation to Enki, Bastet, Isis, Osiris)
Consecrating & Empowering Ritual Tools (using elemental chants)
Power Meditations: Awakenings (for each of the seven major chakras)
EZ Energy Breathing (for chakra and aura empowerment)
Aura Empowering Shield I & II (for protective energetic shielding)
Hatha Yoga Chakra Exercises (specific poses for each chakra)
Chakra Tones Meditation (using musical notes and gemstones)
Kundalini Meditation: Clearing the Chakras (a 7-day progression)
PSI Technology: Energy Balls (for healing, binding, damage, etc.)

relevant_quotes.text: Our devotion, worship, and dedication are to the god Enki/Ea/Ptah, who (with the help of the goddess Ninhursag/Ninmah/Hathor) contributed to the creation of humans thousands of years ago, according to Sumerian records. We are their descendants. It was also Enki who gave us the gift of knowledge and wisdom; the potential to become as gods.

The point is, and you will discover for yourself, the Annunaki are immortal flesh beings and are as real as you are. They move through the astral plane simply out of convenience. We refer to our own plane of existance as the third dimension.
The 7 chakras are the spiritual centers of the soul. If you open these and empower them correctly, you are on your way to being equal with the Gods.
The purpose of the blasphemy rite is to help you banish any remaining purely irrational fears, after you have made an informed decision on a rational level.

To be strong in Enki is to be strong with knowledge. Asking someone else might clue you in a little bit. But to really know what you are doing is to study the information provided on respective websites.

You must never allow yourself to lose this element of control. Your vehicle cannot be stolen unless you allow the passenger to kick you out of the car. You have to allow the deity complete control of your body in order for him/her to completely posess you.

Releasing the Kundalini energy too quickly can have serious emotional effects on a person. One should not attempt to open this thrust of energy if one is not in a balanced psychologically. This is not for those with manic depression or bi-polar disorder.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant within contemporary occultism, particularly for those interested in New Age Paganism, Sumerian and Egyptian esotericism, and 'ancient astronaut' theories. It effectively recontextualizes ancient mythologies, positing them as historical accounts of alien interaction and genetic engineering. The text's strong anti-Christian stance, identifying Jehovah/Enlil as an adversarial force, aligns with certain Luciferian and anti-cosmic currents found in modern Western Esotericism. Its synthesis of traditional concepts (chakras, kundalini, astral projection) with modern self-help and energy work techniques makes it accessible and appealing to a broad segment of the occult community seeking personal empowerment and direct spiritual experience, often outside of established magical lineages. The explicit instructions for practical magic and psychic development position it as an operative manual within these traditions.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists of individuals drawn to Paganism, Western Esotericism, and Occultism who seek personal spiritual development and direct communion with deities. This includes practitioners interested in Sumerian and Egyptian pantheons, 'ancient astronaut' theories (e.g., Zecharia Sitchin's work), and those seeking an alternative to Abrahamic religions (particularly ex-Christians looking to deprogram from past indoctrination). It caters to those who value self-initiation, practical magical exercises, energy work, psychic development, and a non-hierarchical approach to spirituality, emphasizing personal responsibility and knowledge over dogmatic adherence.
